general.headline: Global HR Leader, currently Director, HR Business Partners at RMIT University
general.description:
I am a senior HR leader with global experience across FMCG and telecommunications. I have partnered with C-Suite executives to lead and execute global and regional people strategies that delivered sustainable business change, increased employee engagement and reduced operating costs.

I have led high performing HR teams, and have a reputation as a collaborative, commercial, courageous, empathetic and authentic HR leader.

Key Capabilities:
*People strategy development and execution
*Business and HR transformation
*Cultural change
*Stakeholder engagement and influencing to c-suite and Board
*Talent and diversity management
*People leadership and employee engagement 
*Executive coaching
*Large scale restructuring and productivity improvement
*Industrial relations and enterprise agreement negotiations

jobs.description:
Treasury Wine Estates is a top 50 ASX global wine company with some of the most recognised and awarded wines in the world. TWE employs more than 4,000 staff globally, with revenues in excess of AUD$2 billion. 

In this role led the end to end HR function (>20 employees) for TWE across the Unites States and Canada, supporting over 1200 employees. The Americas business delivers ~$1b revenue for TWE.

I was also responsible for the global talent acquisition, talent management and diversity & inclusion functions (>10 employees) for TWE.

jobs.description:
I led a team of >30 HR generalists responsible for driving strategic and operational HR for over 10,000 employees in Australia and the Philippines. As a member of the business unit senior leadership team, I was responsible for leading the people plan for Telstra Consumer, including onshore and offshore call centres, the Telstra retail store network and the online experience through Telstra Digital. I was also the cross-business unit lead for diversity and labour productivity ($1b annual labour spend), and designed and led the pilot for the “All Roles Flex” initiative, increasing female applications by 30%.

Telstra Consumer was responsible for serving over 10 million customers and contributed over $10 billion in annual revenue for Telstra.

general.headline: Director HR, Talent and Capability at University of Melbourne
general.description:
An accomplished Human Resources Executive, I have had the pleasure and privilege of partnering closely with senior leaders for many years.  I have a passion for, and extensive experience in talent management and succession planning and coaching leaders as well as deep expertise in contemporary Human Resources practices.  I am known for building capability in my teams in order for them to successfully partner with leaders at all levels in order to deliver business results.

As a global citizen, I was born in Scotland and spent my years growing up in Canada, Scotland and England.  I now call Australia home, having lived here for over 30 years.  As an experienced Human Resources Executive with a track record for developing successful leaders, I have held many global HR roles, allowing me to manage and work in virtual teams, travel extensively and collaborate with many different cultures.

With experience spanning manufacturing, mining, professional services as well as small to medium businesses, I have also owned and operated my own consulting and retail businesses.

I invite you to connect.

jobs.description:
The University of Melbourne is consistently ranked number one in Australia and in the
      leading Universities globally.  We are on a journey to embed leadership excellence and
      capability across our leadership teams and the University.  I am passionate about
      delivering on the People Strategy of the University which will deliver and support
      professional growth, define and elevate performance, enable leaders to develop and
      
      coach their teams and attract and retain the best talent.

I partner with people who genuinely want to develop and change.  My focus is creating
      a safe working relationship with individuals who want to be the best they can be while
      being true to who they really are. I encourage people I work with to lead and manage
      
      with authenticity.

In this role I was accountable for end-to-end HR delivery to Amcor Corporate functions on a global basis, predominantly Australia, Europe, Singapore and The Americas.  This included providing advice, counsel and coaching to Corporate Leaders, talent management, executive recruitment, organisation planning, capability reviews, competency frameworks, to name but a few.  Key achievements in this role included project managing the Corporate function transition from Melbourne to Zurich, managing Amcor's first leadership conference in Venice and leading Amcor's global engagement survey.

In this role I led a team of HR advisors to deliver HR to the group functions across BHPB globally. Working with the functional heads of each group I executed the HR agenda in conjunction with their business objectives and, in addition, facilitated leadership development programs and managed a large scale change to the IT function - reducing the function significantly and setting up the new IT hub in Singapore.

During this time I developed a successful HR Consulting business and consulted to a number of organisations on HR policy and practice, executive search, talent management, international assignment program review and relaunch.  Clients included leading organisations in the manufacturing, mining, professional services sectors as well as a legal organisation in the not-for-profit sector.

I initially joined Ernst & young to review their ANZ internal assignment delivery and went on to recruit and develop a dedicated team of international assignment management specialists.   After successfully completing this I commenced (July 2000) in the role of Senior HR Relationship Manager with the Audit, Advisory Business Services (AABS) Division, managing all HR delivery to this Division across Australia.  Leading a team of HR professionals and partnering with the AABS managing partner and leadership team, I also developed and delivered the succession planning model, implemented upward feedback program, delivering feedback reports to the executive team and providing coaching where required. I was also a regional judge for the inaugural Lynne Sutherland Award (recognising those who supported the advancement of diversity and inclusion within the firm).  I was also a member of the EYA Women's Leadership Steering Committee.

After spending some years in internal services roles with the then Price Waterhouse, I moved into a role in a newly created team providing outsourced International Assignment services to global clients.  This was a fairly new market in Australia at the time.  We soon won major clients and I was managing a team of 5 professionals providing IA outsourcing services to clients such as BHP Petroleum, ANZ Bank, Colonial Bank etc.

general.headline: Human Resources Manager at PPG Industries
general.description:
PPG Industries is one of the world's leading coatings and specialty chemical products companies. Established in 1883, PPG employs over 80,000 people globally, with manufacturing facilities in more than 60 countries.  In Australia and New Zealand, PPG is a leading manufacturer of coatings to the automotive, refinish, protective, marine, packaging, architectural and general industrial markets.

PPG Industries values diversity and equal employment opportunities at all levels of the organisation. We have an active Women's Leadership Council in place to drive and support initiatives to improve diversity. We have been recently cited as an employer of Choice for Gender Equality and are immensely proud of our culture and staff offerings that support this status.

jobs.description:
Partnering with the Supply Chain and Functions Leaders at PPG ANZ to deliver the best
      business outcomes through their people.

Leading the HR Function (on an interim basis) for the PPG business across Australia
      
      and New Zealand

Leading the Talent Acquisition and Learning functions within Australia and New Zealand for one of the world's largest and most successful industrial coatings business.

Supporting the business to attract, retain and develop the best talent in the industry with a team of specialists.

Working on a contract for one of Australia’s leading food companies, producers of brands such as Birds Eye, Leggo’s, Edgell, John West, I&J, Lean Cuisine in the Talent & Resourcing team

Supporting the IT, finance, HR and Quality & Innovation Departments on all resourcing requirements including resource planning and resourcing strategy development

Supporting the execution of all resourcing strategies including executing external recruitment campaigns, sourcing contractors for projects and facilitating internal resourcing activity

Managing the recruitment for a number of senior executive searches including Chief Information Officer, National Payroll Director, and R& D Manager

Responsible for the establishment of a first class talent aquisition function for the
      newest, truly local energy company. Viva Energy brings together the strength of two of
      
      the world's foremost energy companies Shell, and Vitol.

Responsible for the talent acquisition
      

    
      and resourcing strategies for the Shell companies in the Oceania Region.

Lead Human Resources Business partner for Shell's Upstream organisation in Perth.
      
      Managed development and delivery of strategic HR business plan and HR team.

Recruitment Manager responsible for leadership of team in delivering Graduate and
      
      Experience Hire recruits to Shell businesses across Europe and Africa.

Led graduate and experienced hire recruitment function for Shell companies in
      
      Australia and New Zealand. Also lead Asia Pacific Experienced Hire recruitment team.

jobs.jobTitle: Director of Human Resources and Strategy

general.headline: Executive Director People
general.description:
A highly adaptable executive with extensive experience in transformation and change across multiple industries and financial dimensions. A proven ability to work across global and complex organisations from entrepreneurial start-ups to the large-scale, multi-national corporate sectors. Industries include digital and technology, financial services, health and telecommunications. 

I am passionate about transforming businesses through technology and people and thrive on equipping the CEO and executive to lead through significant periods of transition, change and growth.

I am a graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors and a Certified member of the Australian Human Resources Institute.

jobs.description:
Reporting to the CEO and a key member of the executive team, this role encompasses all aspects of the people strategy globally. Aconex was, until recently a publicly listed global Australian company providing mobile and web-based collaboration technologies for project information and process management on a software as a service (SaaS) basis to clients in the construction, infrastructure, power, mining, and oil and gas sectors. With more than 50,000 user organisations globally and over 800 employees across 70 different countries, Aconex provides the most widely used cloud-based, multi-company project collaboration solutions for construction and engineering. Aconex was acquired by Oracle in March 2018.

Achievements included:
Trusted advisor to CEO/Co-Founders and Executive team; Successful implementation of global HRIS (Workday); Full strategic review of the global operating model; Implementation of talent management, succession plans and development plans for critical executive roles; Full review and Board endorsement of the executive remuneration framework implemented for FY18; Core member of Oracle/Aconex integration team with successful transition and full integration from June 1 2018.

Responsible for all aspects of the Human Resources and People Strategy for the Retail Division of Telstra, I reported to the Group Executive Retail. The Retail Division contributed over $17bn in revenue to Telstra and included the Consumer & Small to Medium Enterprise business channels, Product portfolio (fixed and mobile), Marketing, Media and the growth business - Telstra Health. The Retail Division employs up to 10,000 staff directly and an additional 15,000 - 20,000 through partner relationships in Australia and the Philippines.

Achievements included:
Contributing to 3 percentage point improvement in strategic NPS, labour efficiency savings of $17m built into financial plans, completion of 15 acquisitions and joint ventures for Telstra Health and the delivery of a new organization wide capability to transform the way employees interface with the customer.

Reporting to the CEO I was responsible for all aspects of the people and culture strategy, internal communications and community, the business transformation office and the company wide efficiency program. Medibank Private is a $5bn business offering private health insurance and health services to over 30% of the Australian population. It employs almost 5000 people and was preparing for an IPO (completed in November 2014). I held management responsibility for the Human Resources/Remuneration Committee reporting to the Principal Board and I was a Director on a number of Medibank Subsidiary Boards.

Achievements included:
Refresh of company strategy; refreshed purpose and values, integration of multiple businesses and outsourcing of payroll platforms and processes, delivery of $50m in savings through a company wide efficiency program and the completion of the new multi-million dollar building project designed to improve cross business unit collaboration, reduce cost and improve efficiency through better space utilization.

allSkills: Strategy, Board Relations, Business Transformation, Change Management, Human Resources, Strategic Planning, Business Process Improvement, Program Management, Financial Risk, Succession Planning, Leadership, Stakeholder Management, Coaching, Culture Change, Talent Management, Governance
